meanings.definition: A mechanical device that allows continuous linear or rotary motion in only one direction.
meanings.sent1: The rachet on the toy car made it move forward smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used a rachet to tighten the bolts on the machine.
meanings.sent3: The rachet on the clock decided it would only move clockwise today.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a rachet, propelling her towards her goals without looking back.
meanings.sent5: The rachet's purpose was clear - to keep things moving in one direction without hesitation.

meanings.definition: To move or cause to move by increments.
meanings.sent1: She had to rachet up her efforts to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers had to rachet the heavy beam into place.
meanings.sent3: He decided to rachet up the volume on the radio to hear his favorite song better.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room seemed to rachet up with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The team needed to rachet their speed to reach the finish line before sunset.

meanings.definition: A tool with a toothed wheel that engages with a pawl to turn a shaft in one direction.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic reached for the rachet to fix the broken gear.
meanings.sent2: She used the rachet to tighten the screws securely in place.
meanings.sent3: The rachet and the pawl had a friendly competition on who could turn the shaft faster.
meanings.sent4: The rachet's teeth gripped the wheel tightly, ensuring a smooth rotation.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the rachet clicking into place signaled the successful completion of the repair.
